timeline.bodyText:
Yes, you would indeed have to put both the predicate and the direct object inside the pattern. My impression is that English avoids excessively long "brackets" and only requires about to be put to the right of the object if it is one (or two?) words long. Is that so?
It was used to occasion it. --> It was used to bring it about.
It was used to occasion those changes. --> It was used to bring those changes about / bring about those changes.
It was used to occasion those long-needed changes in our society. --> It was used to bring about those long-needed changes in our society (not: It was used to bring those long-needed changes in our society about)

+		<rule id="OCCASION_TRANSITIVE_VERB_ARCHAIC" name="transitive verb 'occasion' is archaic" default="temp_off">
+			<antipattern>
+				<token postag="N.*" postag_regexp="yes" inflected="yes">occasion</token>
+			</antipattern>
+			<!-- Avoids false positives caused by the VBZNNS_NNS disambiguator incorrectly returning
+			only VBZ for 'occasions'. See the set of examples marked (*) below. -->
+			<antipattern>
+				<token>on</token>
+				<token postag="JJ|CD|RB" postag_regexp="yes" min="0" max="3" />
+				<token inflected="yes">occasion</token>
+			</antipattern>
+			<pattern>
+				<marker><token postag="VB.*" postag_regexp="yes" inflected="yes">occasion</token></marker>
+			</pattern>
+			<message>The transitive verb "<match no="1" />" is an archaic word choice. Consider a more common synonym, such as <!--
+				--><suggestion><match no="1" postag="VB.*">cause</match></suggestion>, <!--
+				--><suggestion><match no="1" postag="VB.*">induce</match></suggestion>, or <!--
+				--><suggestion><match no="1" postag="VB.*">bring</match> about</suggestion>
+			</message>
+			<url>https://tinyurl.com/yyxj28z8</url>
+			<example correction="caused|induced|brought about">The concert <marker>occasioned</marker> a riot.</example>
+			<example correction="caused|induced|brought about">It was <marker>occasioned</marker> by it.</example>
+			<!-- Not sure yet how to code a suggestion like 'bring [direct object] about'
+			(suggestion should give 'bring it about', not just 'bring about').
+			Would I need to extend the pattern <marker> around the entire direct object? -->

timeline.bodyText: This is interesting, but we should use the url to point to explanations, not to pure data. Also, it's okay to use long URLs, no need for tinyurl.
